summary.long: Joel is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: The word of the Lord that came to Joel, the son of Pethuel:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear this, you elders;
    give ear, all inhabitants of the land!
Has such a thing happened in your days,
    or in the days of your fathers?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Tell your children of it,
    and let your children tell their children,
    and their children to another generation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What the cutting locust left,
    the swarming locust has eaten.
What the swarming locust left,
    the hopping locust has eaten,
and what the hopping locust left,
    the destroying locust has eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Awake, you drunkards, and weep,
    and wail, all you drinkers of wine,
because of the sweet wine,
    for it is cut off from your mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For a nation has come up against my land,
    powerful and beyond number;
its teeth are lions' teeth,
    and it has the fangs of a lioness.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Lament like a virgin wearing sackcloth
    for the bridegroom of her youth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The grain offering and the drink offering are cut off
    from the house of the Lord.
The priests mourn,
    the ministers of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The fields are destroyed,
    the ground mourns,
because the grain is destroyed,
    the wine dries up,
    the oil languishes.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The vine dries up;
    the fig tree languishes.
Pomegranate, palm, and apple,
    all the trees of the field are dried up,
and gladness dries up
    from the children of man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Put on sackcloth and lament, O priests;
    wail, O ministers of the altar.
Go in, pass the night in sackcloth,
    O ministers of my God!
Because grain offering and drink offering
    are withheld from the house of your God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Consecrate a fast;
    call a solemn assembly.
Gather the elders
    and all the inhabitants of the land
to the house of the Lord your God,
    and cry out to the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Alas for the day!
For the day of the Lord is near,
    and as destruction from the Almighty it comes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is not the food cut off
    before our eyes,
joy and gladness
    from the house of our God?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
How the beasts groan!
    The herds of cattle are perplexed
because there is no pasture for them;
    even the flocks of sheep suffer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To you, O Lord, I call.
For fire has devoured
    the pastures of the wilderness,
and flame has burned
    all the trees of the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even the beasts of the field pant for you
    because the water brooks are dried up,
and fire has devoured
    the pastures of the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
a day of darkness and gloom,
    a day of clouds and thick darkness!
Like blackness there is spread upon the mountains
    a great and powerful people;
their like has never been before,
    nor will be again after them
    through the years of all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fire devours before them,
    and behind them a flame burns.
The land is like the garden of Eden before them,
    but behind them a desolate wilderness,
    and nothing escapes them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their appearance is like the appearance of horses,
    and like war horses they run.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As with the rumbling of chariots,
    they leap on the tops of the mountains,
like the crackling of a flame of fire
    devouring the stubble,
like a powerful army
    drawn up for battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Before them peoples are in anguish;
    all faces grow pale.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They leap upon the city,
    they run upon the walls,
they climb up into the houses,
    they enter through the windows like a thief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The earth quakes before them;
    the heavens tremble.
The sun and the moon are darkened,
    and the stars withdraw their shining.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Who knows whether he will not turn and relent,
    and leave a blessing behind him,
a grain offering and a drink offering
    for the Lord your God?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
gather the people.
Consecrate the congregation;
    assemble the elders;
gather the children,
    even nursing infants.
Let the bridegroom leave his room,
    and the bride her chamber.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Between the vestibule and the altar
    let the priests, the ministers of the Lord, weep
and say, “Spare your people, O Lord,
    and make not your heritage a reproach,
    a byword among the nations.
Why should they say among the peoples,
    ‘Where is their God?’”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the Lord became jealous for his land
    and had pity on his people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord answered and said to his people,
“Behold, I am sending to you
    grain, wine, and oil,
    and you will be satisfied;
and I will no more make you
    a reproach among the nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I will remove the northerner far from you,
    and drive him into a parched and desolate land,
his vanguard into the eastern sea,
    and his rear guard into the western sea;
the stench and foul smell of him will rise,
    for he has done great things.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“Be glad, O children of Zion,
    and rejoice in the Lord your God,
for he has given the early rain for your vindication;
    he has poured down for you abundant rain,
    the early and the latter rain, as before.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The threshing floors shall be full of grain;
    the vats shall overflow with wine and oil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will restore to you the years
    that the swarming locust has eaten,
the hopper, the destroyer, and the cutter,
    my great army, which I sent among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You shall eat in plenty and be satisfied,
    and praise the name of the Lord your God,
    who has dealt wondrously with you.
And my people shall never again be put to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You shall know that I am in the midst of Israel,
    and that I am the Lord your God and there is none else.
And my people shall never again be put to shame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“And it shall come to pass afterward,
    that I will pour out my Spirit on all flesh;
your sons and your daughters shall prophesy,
    your old men shall dream dreams,
    and your young men shall see visions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even on the male and female servants
    in those days I will pour out my Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “And I will show wonders in the heavens and on the earth, blood and fire and columns of smoke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The sun shall be turned to darkness, and the moon to blood, before the great and awesome day of the Lord comes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it shall come to pass that everyone who calls on the name of the Lord shall be saved. For in Mount Zion and in Jerusalem there shall be those who escape, as the Lord has said, and among the survivors shall be those whom the Lord calls.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “For behold, in those days and at that time, when I restore the fortunes of Judah and Jerusalem,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will gather all the nations and bring them down to the Valley of Jehoshaphat. And I will enter into judgment with them there, on behalf of my people and my heritage Israel, because they have scattered them among the nations and have divided up my land,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and have cast lots for my people, and have traded a boy for a prostitute, and have sold a girl for wine and have drunk it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “What are you to me, O Tyre and Sidon, and all the regions of Philistia? Are you paying me back for something? If you are paying me back, I will return your payment on your own head swiftly and speedily.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you have taken my silver and my gold, and have carried my rich treasures into your temples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You have sold the people of Judah and Jerusalem to the Greeks in order to remove them far from their own border.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Behold, I will stir them up from the place to which you have sold them, and I will return your payment on your own head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will sell your sons and your daughters into the hand of the people of Judah, and they will sell them to the Sabeans, to a nation far away, for the Lord has spoken.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Hasten and come,
    all you surrounding nations,
    and gather yourselves there.
Bring down your warriors, O Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the nations stir themselves up
    and come up to the Valley of Jehoshaphat;
for there I will sit to judge
    all the surrounding nations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Put in the sickle,
    for the harvest is ripe.
Go in, tread,
    for the winepress is full.
The vats overflow,
    for their evil is great.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Multitudes, multitudes,
    in the valley of decision!
For the day of the Lord is near
    in the valley of decision.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The sun and the moon are darkened,
    and the stars withdraw their shining.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord roars from Zion,
    and utters his voice from Jerusalem,
    and the heavens and the earth quake.
But the Lord is a refuge to his people,
    a stronghold to the people of Israel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“So you shall know that I am the Lord your God,
    who dwells in Zion, my holy mountain.
And Jerusalem shall be holy,
    and strangers shall never again pass through it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“And in that day
the mountains shall drip sweet wine,
    and the hills shall flow with milk,
and all the streambeds of Judah
    shall flow with water;
and a fountain shall come forth from the house of the Lord
    and water the Valley of Shittim.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Egypt shall become a desolation
    and Edom a desolate wilderness,
for the violence done to the people of Judah,
    because they have shed innocent blood in their land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But Judah shall be inhabited forever,
    and Jerusalem to all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will avenge their blood,
    blood I have not avenged,
    for the Lord dwells in Zion.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
